DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Phosphorus Calcium Magnesium Potassium Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a patient's potassium, magnesium, and calcium levels being within normal range prior to randomization

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Phosphorus Calcium Magnesium Potassium Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting to obtain the value of phosphorus, calcium, magnesium, and potassium within the sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol P, atomic number 15, and atomic weight 30.97.:A malleable silvery-white metallic element of the alkaline hearth group; the fifth most abundant element in the earth crust, occurring especially as forms of calcium carbonate. It is an essential constituent of bones and teeth.  It has the symbol Ca and atomic number 20.:An alkaline earth metal, Magnesium is important for many biochemical functions and reactions; for bone and muscle function, protein and fatty acid formation, activation of B vitamins, blood clotting, insulin secretion, and ATP formation. More than 300 enzymes require magnesium for catalytic action. The adult daily requirement is about 300 mg/day. Magnesium is found in many green plants, vegetables, and seeds; chlorophyll is a magnesium-centered porphyrin compound. Magnesium salts are used for magnesium deficiency supplementation. (NCI04):An element with atomic symbol K, atomic number 19, and atomic weight 39.10.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol P, atomic number 15, and atomic weight 30.97.
An element with atomic symbol Ca, atomic number 20, and atomic weight 40.08.

An alkaline earth metal, Magnesium is important for many biochemical functions and reactions; for bone and muscle function, protein and fatty acid formation, activation of B vitamins, blood clotting, insulin secretion, and ATP formation. More than 300 enzymes require magnesium for catalytic action. The adult daily requirement is about 300 mg/day. Magnesium is found in many green plants, vegetables, and seeds; chlorophyll is a magnesium-centered porphyrin compound. Magnesium salts are used for magnesium deficiency supplementation. (NCI04)
An element with atomic symbol K, atomic number 19, and atomic weight 39.10.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient's serum potas
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient's serum potassium, magnesium, and calcium levels been within normal limits for the lab in the past 28 days?
